name: NSColorPickingCustom
desc: A set of methods that provides a way to add color pickers—custom user interfaces for color selection—to an app’s color panel.

items.name: func setColor(NSColor)
items.desc: Adjusts the receiver to make the specified color the currently selected color.

items.name: func currentMode() -> NSColorPanel.Mode
items.desc: Returns the receiver’s current mode (or submode, if applicable).

items.name: func supportsMode(NSColorPanel.Mode) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether or not the receiver supports the specified picking mode.

items.name: func provideNewView(Bool) -> NSView
items.desc: Returns the view containing the receiver’s user interface.
